org.ejvm.util

Class ByteUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ejvm.util.ByteUtil

  • public class ByteUtil
extends Object

    Utility class that contains generic helper methods for the handling of single bytes and byte arrays.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Sebastian Nicolai Kaupe

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ByteUtil() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static byte[] bytesFromShorts(short[] src)
      Creates a new byte array containing the bytes the short values in src are made of.
      static int intFromBytes(byte[] bytes)
      Converts the content of bytes into a single int.
      static int intFromBytes(byte[] bytes, int offset)
      Converts four bytes of the content of bytes into a single int, with the first byte being at index offset.
      static void intIntoBytes(int i, byte[] dst, int offset)
      Converts the int i into its byte representation and stores it in dst, beginning at offset .
      static byte[] intToBytes(int i)
      Converts the int i into a byte[] containing its value in big-endian order.
      static short shortFromBytes(byte[] bytes)
      Converts the content of bytes into a single short.

      Converts two bytes of the content of bytes into a single short, with the first byte being at index offset.

    • Method Detail

      • shortFromBytes

        public static short shortFromBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Converts the content of bytes into a single short.

        Parameters:
        bytes - A byte array to be interpreted as a short.
        Returns:
        The short representation of the contents of bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If bytes is not exactly two bytes long.
        Since:
        1.0

      • shortFromBytes

        public static short shortFromBytes(byte[] bytes,
                   int offset)

        Converts two bytes of the content of bytes into a single short, with the first byte being at index offset.

        Parameters:
        bytes - A byte array to be interpreted as a short.
        offset - The index offset to the first byte.
        Returns:
        The short representation of the contents of bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If bytes is shorter than offset + 2 elements.
        Since:
        1.0

      • intFromBytes

        public static int intFromBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Converts the content of bytes into a single int.

        Parameters:
        bytes - A byte array to be interpreted as a int.
        Returns:
        The int representation of the contents of bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If bytes is not exactly four bytes long.
        Since:
        1.0

      • intFromBytes

        public static int intFromBytes(byte[] bytes,
               int offset)

        Converts four bytes of the content of bytes into a single int, with the first byte being at index offset.

        Parameters:
        bytes - A byte array to be interpreted as a int.
        offset - The index offset to the first byte.
        Returns:
        The int representation of the contents of bytes.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If bytes is shorter than offset + 4 elements.
        Since:
        1.0

      • shortToBytes

        public static byte[] shortToBytes(short s)

        Converts the short s into a byte[] containing its value in big-endian order.

        Parameters:
        s - The short to convert.
        Returns:
        A byte[] representation of s.
        Since:
        1.0

      • intToBytes

        public static byte[] intToBytes(int i)

        Converts the int i into a byte[] containing its value in big-endian order.

        Parameters:
        i - The int to convert.
        Returns:
        A byte[] representation of i.
        Since:
        1.0

      • shortIntoBytes

        public static void shortIntoBytes(int s,
                  byte[] dst,
                  int offset)

        Converts the short s into its byte representation and stores it in dst, beginning at offset .

        Parameters:
        s - The short to convert.
        dst - The array to store the conversion into.
        offset - The starting index for storing in dst.
        Since:
        1.0

      • intIntoBytes

        public static void intIntoBytes(int i,
                byte[] dst,
                int offset)

        Converts the int i into its byte representation and stores it in dst, beginning at offset .

        Parameters:
        i - The int to convert.
        dst - The array to store the conversion into.
        offset - The starting index for storing in dst.
        Since:
        1.0

      • bytesFromShorts

        public static byte[] bytesFromShorts(short[] src)

        Creates a new byte array containing the bytes the short values in src are made of.

        Parameters:
        src - The array containing the short values to be stripped into their single bytes.
        Returns:
        A byte array containing two byte values for every short in src.
        Since:
        1.0
